fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27999].
  {panel}

Recently we tightened up security in all JIRA OnDemand instances by not allowing arbitrary HTML in the project description. We fixed this vulnerability by only allowing plain text or [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] in the project description.

We would like to come up with a compromise if possible that still allows customers to accomplish what they were previously using the project description for in a secure way. In order for that to happen we would like to know how you were using the project description. Please comment on this issue to let us know how you have been using HTML in the project description.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA OnDemand Product Manager
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand project description field

fields.description: When I start @-mentioning people in JIRA, it's incredibly difficult to discern whether anything is actually happening or not. If the server takes several seconds to return a result, you have little to no idea that the feature is even active until you're rather bored of waiting.
fields.summary: Mentions can fail to show results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27996].
  {panel}

* Comment on an issue
* Start to mention someone by typing e.g. _@admin_
* When the mentions bar shows up, clear the entered text *fast* (e.g. by using backspace) - the mentions bar will stay some time and not instantly close
* *Bug:* as soon as the mention expression (_@admin_) is removed while the mentions bar is still visible, the error dialog pops up
* Workaround: slowly remove the mentions expression, so that the error bar vanishes, before the @ is removed
fields.summary: Mentions produces JavaScript error dialog in IE9 when clearing entered mentions expression too fast

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27991].
  {panel}

If I create a custom field of type Select List, then create a new tab on the Default Screen and move the custom field to it, it appears in the tab in Create and Edit screens. The View screen shows the field in the Details section at the top left.

The documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-ConfiguringTabs
has a warning about System fields but not custom fields. With all the UI changes this intended to work in JIRA 5.x?

From the doc page:

"Fields of type 'Date' can only be displayed in the 'Dates' area of the screen, even if they are custom fields.

System fields on the default 'View Issue' screen (e.g. Summary, Security Level, Issue Type, etc.) are fixed and cannot be moved onto a separate tab. However, any other custom fields (except 'Date' fields) that have been added to the 'View Issue' screen can be moved onto a separate tab. 

This restriction only applies to the screen associated with the 'View Issue' operation, i.e. system fields can be moved onto other tabs for screens associated with operations such as 'Create Issue', 'Edit Issue', etc."
fields.summary: Tabs not working in View Screen

fields.description:
JIRA allows us to specify a custom message for the Contact Administrators Form. But apparently, it seems that this do not work in JIRA 5, whereby the configured custom message do not appear in the email form.

Steps to reproduce:
- Login as Administrator
- Go to Administration > General Configuration 
- Enable the Contact Administrators Form option
- Specify the Contact Administrators Message
- Access the contact form via http://host:port/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa

Below is the sample screenshot for the configuration:
- The email form message is configured to Hello World!
!scshot1.png!
- However, it looks like the message is not being displayed in the contact admin email form
!scshot2.png!
fields.summary: Contact Administrators Form do not display custom messages for JIRA 5

fields.description:
This mainly affects the build of ondemand as this bug causes memory leak during xml restore.

AbstractCachingWebPanelRenderer implements DisposableBean to unregister itself from EventManager during plugin shutdown. But since the web-panel-renderer is not managed by Spring, the destroy() method is never called.
it's managed by WebPanelRendererModuleDescriptor, which should overwrite the destroy() method in AbstractModuleDescriptor and ask the AbstractCachingWebPanelRenderer to unregister itself and also clear its cache.
fields.summary: AbstractCachingWebPanelRenderer does not clean up correctly on plugin disabled

When debugging a suspected GreenHopper performance issue in OnDemand, I did some profiling on an instance to get to the root of the problem. It looks as though the Flowdock for JIRA plugin is doing some very expensive PropertySet creation in an IssueEventListener. This might not have been picked up on in regular JIRA usage, as most of the time IssueEvents are fired for only a single issue (create, update, etc). However GreenHopper updates multiple issues at a single time in a loop, and the slowdown caused by this extra code is very noticeable.

OnDemand instances bundle the Flowdock for JIRA plugin by default. Thus this could be a big problem for a lot of customers. Note that I tried to disable the plugin to see if the problem went away, but it still persisted.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27971].
  {panel}

Whilst working on JRADEV-10913 I encountered a bug which I could reproduce only in IE9 (didn't try IE8 yet).

Attached is a dataset which is based on JIRA5.0_QAData.zip in which I created a simple qa-like workflow to help me reproduce the the bug in JRADEV-10913. This, and my lack of experience in setting up workflows, screens, etc, may well be the cause of the issue. However this sort of error should preferably not occur due to user error.

Steps to reproduce:

In IE9: 
- Restore attached data
- Create an issue in the QA project
- Transition the newly created issue to "In Progress" by clicking Workflow -> Start Progress
- Click "QA Time"
- Enter a tester name and submit the form.
-- Please note that sometimes the transition buttons under the Ops Bar do not update. If this occurs then it's certain that there's going to be an SQL error. In this case click Workflows -> Back to In Development
- If no error occurs transition "Back to Development"
- Repeat the above steps alternating tester value from admin to fred and back until an SQL error is displayed as follows:

{quote}
Could not move to history step for #12694: root cause: while inserting: [GenericEntity:OSHistoryStep][id,13052][caller,admin][startDate,2012-04-17 16:19:08.781][status,Not Done][owner,][finishDate,2012-04-17 16:19:32.143][actionId,791][stepId,3][dueDate,null][entryId,12694] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Unique constraint violation: SYS_IDX_107 in statement [INSERT INTO PUBLIC.OS_HISTORYSTEP (ID, ENTRY_ID, STEP_ID, ACTION_ID, OWNER, START_DATE, DUE_DATE, FINISH_DATE, STATUS, CALLER) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)]))
{quote}

fields.description:
When creating a custom field of *any issue type* and with *Global Context*, it will apply to all issues in JIRA.

And, when creating a '_context A_' for a custom field of issue type *'Task'* and project *'BLUE'*, for example, the other Issue Types on the project *'BLUE'* should use the '_Default configuration_' of the custom field created first since it's global. However, this doesn't happen. Every other Issue Type on the project *'BLUE'* "loses" the custom field.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project named *BLUE* and a project named *RED*
# Create a *Select List* custom field for *any issue type* and with *Global Context*
#* Set list options: Hello, Goodbye
# Create a "Context A" for the Issue Type *TASK* and for the project *BLUE*
#* Set list options: Easy, Difficult

h5. Expected behavior:
* When creating an issue with Issue Type *BUG* in the project *RED* it should display 'Hello' and 'Goodbye' options in the custom field
* When creating an issue with Issue Type *TASK* in the project *BLUE* it should display 'Easy' and 'Difficult' options in the custom field
* When creating an issue with Issue Type *IMPROVEMENT* (or any other but *TASK*) in the project *BLUE* it should display 'Hello' and 'Goodbye' options in the custom field

h5. What happens:
* When creating an issue with Issue Type *BUG* in the project *RED* it will display 'Hello' and 'Goodbye' options in the custom field
* When creating an issue with Issue Type *TASK* in the project *BLUE* it will display 'Easy' and 'Difficult' options in the custom field
* When creating an issue with Issue Type *IMPROVEMENT* (or any other but *TASK*) in the project *BLUE* it will not display any custom field
fields.summary: Custom Field is not displayed when there is more than one context defined to the same project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27968].
  {panel}

My goal is to create a new issue, taking some of the field values from an existing issue. 

The fields that should be copied are not known at compile time - they are defined by a parameter, say List<OrderableField> or even List<CustomField>.

IssueService.validateCreate() and IssueService.create() accept IssueInputParameters. 

IssueInputParameters allow to:
1. Set system fields through named methods like setPriority() -- not convenient for this task, and does not allow to change custom fields.
2. Set custom field value by passing "String[]" argument -- not sufficient because I can't extract the correct String[] from an issue.
3. Set action input parameters as if they were passed from the form -- ditto, I can't get those parameters from Issue
4. Use setFieldValuesHolder() to provide a map that will be copied during creation operation -- unfortunately, it's of no use, since values stored there are ignored and overridden by the defaults or taken from the action parameters map.

If there was a way to get the correct "action parameters" String[] for a custom field value of a given Issue, that would solve the problem at the minimum level. Unfortunately, the only way to do that, as far as I can see, is to get the Edit HTML for the issue, then parse it and extract form parameters that would be sent over.
fields.summary: There's no way to get a field value from Issue and use it for creating/updating another issue with IssueService

I have an issue where I want the following text essentially rendered as it is read:
{noformat}
1) Create new content entry for bundle (type 22) in #__content table
2) Add entry to #__access_bundles table for metadata (not if has variations, request_* can be their default values)
3) Create any variations in #__access_bundle_variations table and link to bundle
4) Create provisioning links #__content_identity_relationships with the context "provisioning" linking the content to an identity representing the target role.
5) ??
6) Profit
{noformat}

What happens normally is as follows:

1) Create new content entry for bundle (type 22) in #__content table
2) Add entry to #__access_bundles table for metadata (not if has variations, request_* can be their default values)
3) Create any variations in #__access_bundle_variations table and link to bundle
4) Create provisioning links #__content_identity_relationships with the context "provisioning" linking the content to an identity representing the target role.
5) ??
6) Profit


Notice how the second line is italicised incorrectly. Ideally I want to be able to tell JIRA not to go all fancy on the text but it isn't pre-formatted text so I don't want the ugly text box that comes with that just because JIRA's formatter is being silly. I just want to tell it to disable the formatter but not switch to preformatted text mode (e.g. wrap like normal text).
fields.summary: Option to disable formatter but not wrap in frame

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27959].
  {panel}

When using the config tool to change the port number of Tomcat or changing the tomcat port number in server.xml, the base URL still points to the old port number.  

Steps to replicate : 
1. Go to system menu and click on General Configuration 
2. Check the base URL and note the port number.  
3. Go to config tool using config.bat and change the webserver port number from the current one (eg. 8080) to let say 80
4. Save config and restart JIRA
5. Go to system menu and click on General Configuration 
6. The base URL still points to the old port number of 8080.  

Because of this, the links in Activity Stream still refer to the old port number.

Workaround is to edit the configuration to modify the port number.
fields.summary: Base URL's port number does not change after changing in server.xml file

fields.description:
This is a performance improvement for the issue navigator. Steps to reproduce:
1. Load a large dataset (e.g. the dataset we use for Grinder tests)
2. Hit the issue navigator with multiple concurrent requests while profiling. I used this script:
bq. for i in `jot 2000`; do echo $i; done | parallel -j 5 'curl -s -X POST -u admin:admin "http://localhost:8081/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?runQuery=true&_={}&pager/start=10"'
3. The AbstractFieldLayoutManager.getFieldLayout(Issue) method emerges as taking up a lot of time because it is loading the project and issue type objects needlessly. Strictly speaking, only their ids are necessary.

See attached screenshot.

cc: [~jwinters]
fields.summary: AbstractFieldLayoutManager.getFieldLayout(Issue) spends a lot of time loading issue type and project when it doesn't need to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27952].
  {panel}

Modify JIRA's *User Name Menu > Online Help* link so that it points to the configured home page in JIRA documentation spaces on Atlassian's documentation site.

Please modify this online help link so that it points to:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-050/ (which currently resolves to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA - via the redirect implemented on https://docs.atlassian.com, which in turn leads to the home page for this 'JIRA' space)

instead of:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-050/JIRA+Documentation (which currently resolves to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Documentation - again via the redirect implemented on https://docs.atlassian.com)

As part of a documentation consistency strategy, we recently renamed the JIRA Documentation home page from *JIRA Documentation* to *JIRA Documentation Home*, which resulted in JIRA's *Online Help* link breaking (see JRA-27888).

The space home page (which can be configured at the following space admin-accessible URL of any Confluence site http://<confluence-site>/spaces/editspace.action?key=SPACEKEY) can be changed to the name of whatever page in the space you want and when it is, any page that goes to the following URL:

* http://<confluence-site>/display/SPACEKEY/

will be interpreted/resolved/redirected by Confluence itself to:

* http://<confluence-site>/display/SPACEKEY/Name+of+Space+Home+Page (which is the one configured at the 'editspace' URL above).

Hence, my reason for requesting that the Online Help link in the product is fixed itself (as mentioned at the top of this comment), since it gives the tech writers flexibility over changing the name of the space home page (without external links pointing to that page breaking).
fields.summary: Modify JIRA's "User Name Menu > Online Help" link so that it points to the configured home page in JIRA documentation spaces on Atlassian's documentation site.

fields.description:
Adding plugins to JIRA increases the number of entries under the "More Actions" drop-down.  At a certain point, usually after adding the latest GreenHopper _and_ Bonfire (which add entries to this column), the column length exceeds our minimum vertical height (768 pixels) within the Browser view.  The only way around this is to shrink the text-size and space (via Ctrl/Cmd-Minus) until the entry is visible.

While the above method provides a workaround, this is a problem for most laptop users (including Macbook Air users) that wish to use all of our products.

fields.description:
JIRA OnDemand doesn't provide edit project permission to users with administer project permission.

As the documentation states that:
{quote}
A project administrator in JIRA is someone who has the project-specific Administer Projects project permission, but not necessarily the JIRA Administrator global permission .

Without the JIRA Administrator global permission , however, project administrators can do the following:

* Edit the project name
* Edit the project description
* Edit the project avatar image
* Edit the project URL
* Edit the project lead
* Edit project role membership
* Define project components
* Define project versions
* View, but not select nor edit the project's schemes (notification scheme, permission scheme, etc)
{quote}

When user tries the above, permission violation dialogue will be shown.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand doesn't provide edit project permission to users with administer project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27936].
  {panel}

At the moment in REST, you can only update/edit a field in an issue if it is part of the edit screen for that project/issuetype.

It is desirable to be able to opt into editing any field in the field config for that project/issuetype.

For example, a {{skipScreenCheck=true}} query param. You should also be able to ask for the full edit-meta for non-screen fields with {{skipScreenCheck=true}}.

One usecase is exemplified by JRA-27929, where the "lables" field is not in the edit screen config, but is in fact editable on the view-issue screen anyway.
fields.summary: Add ability to use setSkipScreenCheck() when updating an issue via REST

  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Log in as a user that's a member of a group with "Manage Group Filter Subscriptions" global permission (by default only "jira-developers").
# Search for a filter, click "Subscribe".
# In the Recipients dropdown choose "Personal Subscription".
# In the next screen, click "Run now".

When the email is flushed from the mail queue, the following error appears in the logs:

{code:none}
2012-04-18 23:46:07,388 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem owner: [...] /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem] Group 'Personal Subscription' referenced in subscription '10004' of filter '10300' does not exist.
{code}

And the user never receives the email.

If you subscribe when you're _not_ a member of a group with "Manage Group Filter Subscriptions" global permission, everything works as expected and the subscription email is delivered.
fields.summary: "Personal Subscription" filter subscriptions never send - tries to send to non-existent group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27917].
  {panel}

I frequently observe this:

- Perform any query
- Click on the first issue to view it. Top right corner will have the two triangles for navigating to next/previous issue.
- I usually keep the mouse at the "next" triangle and click it to move on to the next issue, then briefly read the issue (e.g. when reviewing recently added ones)

What is annyoing is that the position of the triangles slightly changes, depending on whether the issue is long (and a scrollbar appears at the right border). If this happens, I need to reposition the mouse. If the scrollbar vanishes for the next issue (because it is short), I have to reposition the mouse again.

Even worse, it happens easily to click on the "Return to search" link which slides under the mouse pointer in the latter case.

Usability would be greatly improved if the arrows could stay at the same position independent of whether a scroll bar is currently shown or not.
fields.summary: Browsing Search Results: Position of Arrows

Trying to @mention people on JAC is so slow that its kinda pointless.

Problem number 1 is that it takes 5 seconds to do a  look up at the moment

Problem number 2 is one of UX.  There is no easy way to see that a request is happening and hence you keep typing and hence it cancels the request and hence you get no results so you remove some of the typing thinking it doesnt work and then there are still no results and... you get the picture.

According to my analysis, this will happen if the Field configuration doesn't allow Component at all and an issue is created. If the Component is allowed in the Field configuration, but, not part of any screen configuration (so not editable), then the issue doesn't occur...

It also seem that if I activate the Field Component in the field section, then *existing* issue will not be fixed immediately by this ADMIN change, instead, If I go to Screen, add the field to the edit screen, go to the existing issue, edit the component, set it to something, edit it again, set it to null (no component), then the problem is gone and I can load again the Issues tab.


I haven't tried JIRA 5.0.2, so maybe this is fixed in this release, I've tried search the Atlassian JIRA for similar issue but failed to find it (sorry if I missed it).

Regards,
Johan.

fields.description:
Jira is integrated with Crowd and when you try to add a user in JIRA, you get the following error. However despite of an exception, you find user is getting created in JIRA and also flowing down to Crowd.

{noformat}
2012-03-27 15:19:24,912 http-8085-6 ERROR [500ErrorPage.jsp] Exception caught in 500 page Could not invoke service.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Could not receive fault.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: No write method for property {http://rmi.java}cause in class java.rmi.RemoteException
org.codehaus.xfire.XFireRuntimeException: Could not invoke service.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Could not receive fault.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: No write method for property {http://rmi.java}cause in class java.rmi.RemoteException
org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Could not receive fault.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: No write method for property {http://rmi.java}cause in class java.rmi.RemoteException
at org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault.createFault(XFireFault.java:89)
at org.codehaus.xfire.client.Invocation.invoke(Invocation.java:83)
at org.codehaus.xfire.client.Invocation.invoke(Invocation.java:114)
{noformat}

You also see a lot of this in logs:

{noformat}
2012-03-27 15:45:36,381 main WARN [org.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'org.jdom.output' with different versions. Files: jdom-1.0.jar and crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jdom-1.0.jar'
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar'
2012-03-27 15:45:36,382 main WARN [org.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'org.jdom.input' with different versions. Files: jdom-1.0.jar and crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jdom-1.0.jar'
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar'
2012-03-27 15:45:36,382 main WARN [org.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'org.jdom' with different versions. Files: jdom-1.0.jar and crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jdom-1.0.jar'
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar'
2012-03-27 15:45:36,382 main WARN [org.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'org.jdom.filter' with different versions. Files: jdom-1.0.jar and crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jdom-1.0.jar'
'/data/atlassian/jira-4.2.4/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/crowd-integration-client-2.4.0.jar'
{noformat}

The root problem is because the passwords are not being set in the delegated LDAP directory that is attached via Crowd.
This is not really an error but just LDAP saying "Sorry you can't do that". The system tries to set the password after the user is created, which is why you are seeing what you are seeing. The messages "Package Scanner found duplicates for package" is annoying but not really an issue here.

In fact, in JIRA 4.2 the code does try and set the password unconditionally, so setting External Password Management On won't actually help.

This whole area has been completely rewritten in JIRA 4.3 onward and this particular behaviour is no longer a problem.

fields.description:
A link will created under the history tab for the imported attachment which lead to wrong attachment. The situation occurs when user try to move some project from one instance to another.

Steps to reproduce:
# Attach an attachment 1 to a ticket in instance A. The first attachment id in database will be 10000.
# Attach an attachment 2 to a ticket in instance B. The first attachment id in database will be 10000 as well.
# Export instance A as xml backup and project import into instance B.
# A link will created for attachment 1 in instance B under the history tab. However, when click upon to the link, user will get to attachment 2 instead of attachment 1.

NOTE: Check in the database where the both attachments in change history table still retain the same value which are 10000 respectively. However, the fileattachment table has a different value for both attachments.

A link will created under the history tab for the imported attachment which lead to wrong attachment. The situation occurs when user try to move some project from one instance to another.

Steps to reproduce:
# Attach an attachment 1 to a ticket in instance A. The first attachment id in database will be 10000.
# Attach an attachment 2 to a ticket in instance B. The first attachment id in database will be 10000 as well.
# Export instance A as xml backup and project import into instance B.
# A link will created for attachment 1 in instance B under the history tab. However, when click upon to the link, user will get to attachment 2 instead of attachment 1.

NOTE: Check in the database where the both attachments in change history table still retain the same value which are 10000 respectively. However, the fileattachment table has a different value for both attachments.

h4.Workaround
*PostgreSQL:*
# Backup JIRA (recommended to test in a staging environment)
# Run the SQL queries below to retrieved the wrong attachment links:
{code}
	select 
	CI.id as "Changeitem ID",
	concat(P.pkey,'-',I.issuenum) as "Issue Key", 
	(select id from fileattachment where filename = CI.newstring) as "Correct Attachment ID",
	CI.newstring as "Attachment name",
	CI.newvalue as "Current Attachment ID",
	A.filename as "Wrong Attachment name"
	from changeitem CI
	join fileattachment A on CI.newvalue = cast(A.id as text)
	join changegroup CG on CI.groupid = CG.id
	join jiraissue I on I.id = CG.issueid
	join project P on P.id = I.project
	where CI.field = 'Attachment'
	and CG.issueid != A.issueid;
{code}
# Run the SQL queries below to update the *newvalue* column ID to the correct *Attachment ID*:
{code}
update changeitem set newvalue = <correct_attachment_ID> where id = <changeitem_ID>;
{code}
# Restart JIRA.

*Oracle:* 
# Backup JIRA (recommended to test in a staging environment)
# Run the SQL query below:
{code}
MERGE INTO changeitem ci
   USING ((select * from (select concat(P.pkey,concat('-',I.issuenum)) as ISSUENUM, ci.id,A.id as "WRONG ATT ID",
(select LISTAGG(A1.id,',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY A1.id DESC) from fileattachment A1 where to_char(A1.created,'dd-mon-yyyy hh')=to_char(CG.created,'dd-mon-yyyy hh') and A1.issueid=CG.issueid and A1.filename=to_char(CI.newstring)) as "CORRECT ATT ID", 
CI.newstring as "ATT NAME", to_char(CG.created, 'dd-mon-yyyy hh:mi:ss PM') as "CREATED"
from changeitem CI
join fileattachment A on to_char(CI.newvalue) = to_char(A.id)
join changegroup CG on CI.groupid = CG.id
join jiraissue I on I.id = CG.issueid
join project P on P.id = I.project
where CI.field = 'Attachment'
and CG.issueid <> A.issueid 
order by ISSUENUM desc))) wids
   ON (CI.field = 'Attachment' and ci.id=wids.id)
   WHEN MATCHED THEN UPDATE SET CI.newvalue = wids."CORRECT ATT ID"
{code}
# Restart JIRA.

fields.description:
After the expiration of our jira/greenhopper maintenance period, the greenhopper plugin is not activated anymore.
The problem is reproducible and linked to the UPM bug described here: GHS-4887.
Unlike the systems described in the afore mentioned ticket, our system was already at versions:
Jira: 5.0.2
Greenhopper: 5.9.3
UPM: 2.1.1
(we had just upgraded everything on the 02. of april)
So there should not have been any issue with Greenhopper falling out of service on the 12. of april at 16oo when our maintenance contract expired.
The error i see when i start jira is 
"com.atlassian.extras.common.LicenseException: You cannot update to GreenHopper version 5.9.3. Updates are no longer available." --> this version was already activated prior to the expiration of the maintenance period.
I have already tried to upgrade the UPM to 2.1.2 and Greenhopper to 5.9.4, each separately and in all constellations together (virtual machine snapshots be thanked), but to no avail. After contacting our atlassian representative, who confirmed that there should be no issue with out licences, I am posting this as a bug.
Anyone have any similar issues?
fields.summary: Universal Plugin Manager Disables Greenhopper after maintenance expiration
